Who am I?

Who am I?

Software Engineer (my past), ML Engineer (my present), Data Scientist (my future).

I don't believe in a magic solutions. I believe that consistency is the key for creating a successful software/model.

My favorite coding language is the langauge that helps me achieve my goal. If I were building and training a machine learning model, then my favourite language is Python.
If I were working with Android development, then it would be JAVA.

The university of Illinois Urbana Champaign is the place which made me loved the world of AI/ML/DL.
Apart from its huge Electronic Library, it helped me connect with professionals and likeminded people to build/trian/evaluate models. Weekly online meetings were the key to our success.

MY Experience

Movie Recommender System

- The model is trained Using MovieLens Dataset which comprises approximately 1 million ratings for 3,706 movies, provided by 6,040 users.
- The system has two different algorithms, Firstly, Building a recommendation System based on Popularity. Secondly, Recommendation Based on IBCF.
- IBCF based on ' Similar users have similar tastes'.
- Similarity matrix is generated using Centered Cosine Similarity approach.
- The model is evaluated using weighted similarity matrix.
- Team based (3 members, located in the USA, the UAE, and Kuwait.
- Collaboration via weekly online meetings via zoom and Google colab for coding.
- Github for version control is used

Demo

Movie Review Sentiment Analysis

Build a Binary Classification Model.
- Embedding generated by OpenAI’s text-embedding-3-large.
- Implemented Logistic Regression with Elastic Net regularization (`penalty=’elasticnet’`).
- Hyperparameters: ex: `C=5`:: Inversely proportional to regularization strength.
- Training: The model was trained on the preprocessed and vectorized training data, learning to associate feature patterns with sentiment labels.
Interpretability Analysis
- Prediction: After training, the model predicts the probability of each review belonging to the positive sentiment class.
- Evaluation Metric: Utilized the Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUC-ROC) to assess the model’s performance.
- Local Interpretability with LIME.
model.
